header_summary:
Cory Fields reports on Hennadii Stepanov's efforts to transition Bitcoin Core's build system from Autotools to CMake, highlighting the benefits this shift brings to the project and its developers. The move, anticipated to integrate after the v28 feature-freeze, aims to streamline development processes and enhance usability for both the Bitcoin Core team and the wider open-source community. This transition underscores a commitment to modernizing the project’s infrastructure, with documentation and guidance readily available for those adapting to the change ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/6cfd5a56-84b4-4cbc-a211-dd34b8942f77n@googlegroups.com/T/#u#m4526371f167fea9fe6a681f529d7ac400cb35906)).

In a separate discussion, Murch elaborates on Zawy's Alternating Timestamp Attack on the Bitcoin Testnet 4, revealing a sophisticated method to exploit block timestamp manipulations for undue mining advantages. This strategy, diverging from traditional attacks by requiring control over the majority of block timestamps, poses significant threats to network stability and necessitates a proposed softfork for mitigation. Such vulnerabilities and countermeasures highlight ongoing challenges in maintaining blockchain security and integrity ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/zawy-s-alternating-timestamp-attack/1062)).

MattCorallo and 0xB10C address potential Distributed Denial of Service (DoS) threats and Bitcoin Core's compact block reconstructions, respectively. While Corallo criticizes the lack of foundational analysis on DoS risks via onion messages, suggesting a "backpressure" mitigation strategy, 0xB10C focuses on the technical aspect of enhancing block reconstructions to improve network efficiency. These discussions reflect a proactive approach towards identifying and mitigating vulnerabilities, underscoring the community's dedication to fortifying Bitcoin's infrastructure against diverse threats ([DoS threats source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/onion-messaging-dos-threat-mitigations/1058/2), [compact block reconstructions source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/stats-on-compact-block-reconstructions/1052/4)).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core's migration to the CMake buildsystem
recent_posts.summary:
- Hennadii Stepanov is transitioning Bitcoin Core's system from Autotools to CMake.
- This change, meant for after the v28 feature-freeze, aims for simplicity and modernization.
- Documentation for CMake is updated, supporting feature parity and easing user transition.

recent_posts.title: Zawy’s Alternating Timestamp Attack
recent_posts.summary:
- Zawy's attack on Bitcoin Testnet involves manipulating block timestamps to ease difficulty adjustments.
- The attack allows accelerated block production by alternately setting future and past timestamps.
- A proposed softfork aims to mitigate such attacks by enforcing consistent timestamp increases.

recent_posts.title: Onion Messaging DoS Threat Mitigations
recent_posts.summary:
- The paper focuses on mitigating DoS threats in onion messaging without foundational proof.
- It aims to prevent routing loops, a major concern, despite lacking formal risk analysis.
- Lightning developers agree on a "backpressure" strategy for potential DoS issues, specifics unclear.

recent_posts.title: Stats on compact block reconstructions
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion highlights Bitcoin Core's use of a specialized pool for block reconstructions.
- It details a command line option that controls extra transactions retained for this purpose.
- This approach differs from analyzing network performance, emphasizing blockchain efficiency.

active_posts.title: Proposing a P2QRH BIP towards a quantum resistant soft fork
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal recommends incorporating quantum resistance into Bitcoin by introducing a new signature algorithm.
- It marks the start of a series aimed at protecting Bitcoin from quantum vulnerabilities via a "QuBit" soft fork.
- The document is open for community feedback, encouraging active participation to refine this quantum-resistant framework.

active_posts.title: Public disclosure of 2 vulnerabilities affecting Bitcoin Core < v22.0
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core has bugs in all versions before v22.0, enhancing security measures.
- A new vulnerability disclosure policy is adopted, details on their website's security page.
- Vulnerabilities from versions v23.0 and v24.0 will be disclosed in August and September.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Knots 27.1.knots20240801 released
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Knots released version 27.1.knots20240801, enhancing user experience and fixing bugs.
- Users can report issues via GitHub and subscribe to updates on the software's website.
- Comprehensive release notes detailing improvements are available on GitHub.

active_posts.title: BIP352: PSBT support
active_posts.summary:
- Discussions highlight PSBTs enhancing cryptocurrency privacy and security through silent payments.
- A viable spending method using `PSBT_IN_PROPRIETARY` and `shared_secret_tweak` shows immediate implementation potential.
- Delvingless-andrewtoth's draft BIP proposes an `OutputGenerator` role for simplified silent payment integration.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The analysis discusses improving Bitcoin's security and performance by addressing protocol vulnerabilities.
- It proposes solutions for the timewarp vulnerability and issues with non-SegWit transactions.
- Community debate arises over suggestions like reducing block size and standardizing technical elements.

active_posts.title: Bolt 12 Trusted Contacts
active_posts.summary:
- Bolt 12 enhances user experience by allowing payments without sharing Bolt 11 invoices.
- It proposes a method for identity revelation through `contact_key` sharing in transactions.
- Feedback is sought to refine selective identity revelation, improving privacy and security.

today_in_history_posts.title: Bitcoin Core to disable Bloom-based Filtering by default
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Matt Corallo proposed disabling bloom filter serving by default in Bitcoin Core.
- Will Madden disagreed, citing the negative impact on SPV wallets and centralization.
- The change aims to resolve known DoS vulnerabilities in the network.

today_in_history_posts.title: Proposal: Automated Inbound Liquidity With Invoices
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal aims to automate instant inbound liquidity for Lightning Network payments.
- It suggests embedding the invoice creator's node uri and payment amount for automatic channel creation.
- Specifics like channel size and routing node premiums still require clarification.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Passive and active investments are two distinct strategies with specific characteristics.
- Passive investment issues include the principal/agent problem and potential underutilization of assets.
- The article explores stabilizing economies through a currency system backed by Bitcoin.
